solution_line_template: First find the cost of one pair of ballet slippers: ${high_heels_price} * {ballet_slippers_fraction} = $<<{high_heels_price}*{ballet_slippers_fraction}={cost_one_ballet_slipper}>>{cost_one_ballet_slipper}

Then find the total cost of the ballet slippers: ${cost_one_ballet_slipper}/pair * {num_ballet_slippers} pairs = $<<{cost_one_ballet_slipper}*{num_ballet_slippers}={total_cost_ballet_slippers}>>{total_cost_ballet_slippers}

Then add that amount to the cost of the high heels to find the total cost: ${total_cost_ballet_slippers} + ${high_heels_price} = $<<{total_cost_ballet_slippers}+{high_heels_price}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
